CustomField.description:
The formula for finding business hours between two Date/Time values expands on the formula for finding elapsed business days. It works on the same principle of using a reference Date/Time, in this case 1/8/1900 at 16:00 GMT (9 a.m. PDT), and then finding your Dates’ respective distances from that reference. The formula rounds the value it finds to the nearest hour and assumes an 8–hour, 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. work day.
https://resources.docs.salesforce.com/212/latest/en-us/sfdc/pdf/formula_date_time_tipsheet.pdf
https://success.salesforce.com/answers?id=9063A000000iXTlQAM
changed 8 to 9 in the first line of formula (9 hour work day including Lunch) and changed the DATETIMEVALUE( '1900-01-08 16:00:00' ) to DATETIMEVALUE( '1900-01-08 11:00:00' ) as DateTime values are stored in GMT, you will have to add the difference of the hours.
CustomField.label: Resolved Time (Business Hours)
